title: 15 reasons Sydney is the best place in Australia
text:
IT’S the city that attracts millions of visitors every year. Let’s find out why Sydneysiders and visitors alike think Sydney is still awesome. 
1. The unforgettable view on arrival. 
How many cities will give you a complete, bird’s eye view of the city before you even touch the ground? Harbour Bridge and Opera House. Boom. Photo: lensaloft.com.au Source: Supplied 
2. Australia’s most famous beach is here. 
OK, Bondi Beach is our most famous beach. Hands down. You don’t hear about TV shows called, ‘Byron Bay Rescue’ or ‘Noosa Vet’, do you? And Bondi Vet. Picture: Richard Dobson Source: News Corp Australia We have Bondi Rescue. Picture: Richard Dobson Source: News Corp Australia 
3. You can eat at Australia’s best restaurant 
Neil Perry’s Rockpool restaurant was named Gourmet Traveller magazine’s 2015 Restaurant of the Year. It’s officially the best restaurant for Modern Australian dining, and for dining in general. 
RELATED: This is the best restaurant in Australia 
4. You can eat the best gelato in the world 
Enmore’s Cow and the Moon beat Italy’s gelato artisans to win the Gelato World Tour title with their Mandorla affogato flavour. Cue the drooling mouths. All this goodness is found in Sydney. Source: News Corp Australia 
5. The home of the Budgy Smuggler 
You either love them, or hate them. Either way, there’s no doubt Sydney brand Budgy Smuggler are taking the world by storm. Their headquarters are in Manly — what a perfect place to try out new styles and patterns. Great view, Darren Palmer. Source: Brett Costello Source: News Corp Australia 
6. Darling Harbour is the most Facebooked location 
Releasing its annual review, Facebook revealed that Sydney’s Darling Harbour was the most popular location for Facebook check-ins in Australia. We think the giant rubber duck helped the cause ... Lots of check-in opportunities here. Source: AFP/Greg Wood Source: AFP 
7. It’s not the capital of Australia 
Sorry, Canberrans. Contrary to what some people may think, Sydney isn’t the capital. So many people think it is (Australians too, shameful) — but it gets all the credit of being a capital without having the responsibility. I'm such a geek... Every time someone in WTM tweets something with my name (aka the capital of Australia) in it, I feel all giddy  — Sydney Samery (@SydSamery) September 13, 2015 
8. It hosted the best Olympics in Australia ... ever 
Who can remember anything about Melbourne’s hosting of the Games? OK, it’s understandable that they were hosted in 1956. But thanks to seventh president of the International Olympic Committee, Juan Antonio Samaranch claim during the closing of the 2000 Olympics: “The Winner is ... Sydney.” We still recall the epic visions of Nikki Webster flying midair and Kylie dancing on a giant thong ... you won’t forget them too easily. 
9. The birthplace of the Nutella doughnut milkshake 
This is food porn at its best. It’s a milky Nutella shake topped with a doughnut. The indulgent and crazy idea was concocted by Erskineville’s Foodcraft Espresso . They’ve just introduced a triple-decker version ... Triple decka Tella Shake 
10. Sydney has the world’s best airport lounge 
According to the DesignAir , Qantas’ First Class Lounge at Sydney’s Kingsford-Smith Airport is ranked the number one lounge in the world. For those who are lucky enough to be allowed in, the lounge provides spa, restaurant (with a menu created by Neil Perry) and loads of personal space. Fashion designer, Whitney Port enjoys all the lounge has to offer. Source: Bradley Hunter Source: News Limited 
11. It beats Melbourne in the battle of the tweets 
With three dedicated accounts, Sydney’s Twitter followers only just outweigh Melbourne’s. It’s a close fight, but Sydney is out swinging. 
13. The home of Jarryd Hayne 
For all you NRL and NFL fans out there, Sydney was blessed with raising the Hayne Plane. Just in case San Francisco tries to claim him, we had him first. Sydney is home to a sporting god. Source: AFP Source: AFP 
14. The most Instagrammed city in Australia 
From shots of Bondi and Manly beaches, to the Sydney Opera House, Sydney is the home of the filtered photo and hashtags. 
15. It hosts the two biggest parties of the year 
The Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras and New Year’s Eve are some of the world’s biggest parties. Attracting thousands of partygoers and millions of viewers, each event brings life and buzz to the city. Sydney’s NYE fireworks bring the fun every year. Source: News Corp Australia If you’re looking for a party, Sydney’s the best place to be. Source: Supplied
